'''Ronnel Arryn''' is an unseen character in ''[[Game of Thrones]]''. He is deceased when the events of the series begin and is not expected to appear in the series.

He is not to be confused with his ancestor and namesake, King [[Ronnel Arryn (King)|Ronnel Arryn]], who lived during the [[War of Conquest|Targaryen Conquest]] almost three centuries before.
sections.In the books: In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, Ronnel's family was unchanged. Ronnel died around the same time his son Elbert was born, however, Elbert himself died when he was executed by the Mad King [[Aerys II Targaryen]] alongside [[Rickard Stark|Rickard]] and [[Brandon Stark (Son of Rickard)|Brandon Stark]] at the beginning of [[Robert's Rebellion]], extinguishing Ronnel's line.
sections.Biography:
===Background===
Ronnel was the son of [[Jasper Arryn]], the Head of [[House Arryn]] and the [[Lord of the Eyrie]]. He had two older siblings: [[Jon Arryn|Jon]] and [[Alys Arryn|Alys]].<ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season1/#!/guide/houses/arryn/ HBO viewers guide season 1 Arryn family tree]</ref>
